[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_ETHIOPIAN_OROMO_CAVALRY_NAME]Oromo Cavalry
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_MENELIK_HILLS_COMBAT_DESCRIPTION]+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on Hills (Council of Ministers)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_MENELIK_HILLS_COMBAT_NAME]Ethiopian Highlands
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_ABILITY_MENELIK_HILLS_COMBAT_STRENGTH_DESCRIPTION]+{1_Amount} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength (Council of Ministers)

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS_DESCRIPTION]Enjoys building on and around Hills if possible, and likes other civilizations that leave the areas near Hills to him. Dislikes those who also settle and build on and around Hills.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS_NAME]Ethiopian Highlands
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CITY_YIELD_FROM_RESOURCES_TOOLTIP]{Value : number +#.#;-#.#} from Resources
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_ETHIOPIA_ADJECTIVE]Ethiopian
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_ETHIOPIA_DESCRIPTION]Ethiopian Empire
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_CIVILIZATION_ETHIOPIA_NAME]Ethiopia
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MODIFIER_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS]Menelik wants you to settle your cities far from any hills

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_GAMEMODE_SECRETSOCIETIES_DESCRIPTION]This game mode adds up to four powerful, mysterious, and often nefarious Secret Societies to the world, each based upon fictional or mythical organizations from the past. Their traces can be found in Barbarian Camps, Tribal Villages, or by sending Envoys to City-States and finding Natural Wonders. Alternatively, if other leaders have discovered a Society, you can learn about them by increasing your diplomatic visibility levels with them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Discovering a Society does not mean joining it automatically, but it unlocks a new Governor that does not need to be assigned to a city. Spending a Governor Title on this governor means joining the society, giving you powerful bonuses. But choose wisely - once you appoint that Governor, you commit to membership for the rest of the game, and other leaders will react to your decision. Spend additional Governor Titles to prove your commitment to the Society and unlock its deeper mysteries.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_GAMEMODE_SECRETSOCIETIES_NAME]Secret Societies Mode

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_ROCK_HEWN_CHURCH_DESCRIPTION]Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Rock-Hewn Church, unique to Ethiopia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Mountain and Hills tile. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from [ICON_FAITH] Faith, after researching Flight. +1 Appeal. Can only be built on Hills not adjacent to another Rock-Hewn Church.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_ROCK_HEWN_CHURCH_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION]Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Rock-Hewn Church, unique to Ethiopia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Mountain and Hills tile. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from [ICON_FAITH] Faith, after researching Flight. +1 Appeal. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters. Can only be built on Hills or Volcanic Soil not adjacent to another Rock-Hewn Church.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_IMPROVEMENT_ROCK_HEWN_CHURCH_NAME]Rock-Hewn Church
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LEADER_MENELIK_NAME]Menelik II

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_LOADING_INFO_LEADER_MENELIK]Menelik II, great King and Emperor, you have a vision for your people. You will build both friendships and factories, alliances and railways, and use your wits and your wisdom to bring Ethiopia into a bright and free future.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TOOLTIP_SAMPLE_DIPLOMACY_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS]Likes those who settle far from the hills
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TOOLTIP_SAMPLE_DIPLOMACY_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS_NEGATIVE]Menelik is upset that you compete with him for the hills
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TOOLTIP_SAMPLE_DIPLOMACY_ETHIOPIAN_HIGHLANDS_POSITIVE]Menelik is pleased that you leave the highlands to him

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_ETHIOPIA_DESCRIPTION]Ethiopia’s International Trade Routes grant +0.5 [ICON_Faith] Faith per resource at the origin. Improved resources provide +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each copy the city owns. Can purchase Archaeological Museums and Archaeologists with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_CIVILIZATION_ETHIOPIA_NAME]Aksumite Legacy

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_MENELIK_DESCRIPTION]Receive [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 15% of your [ICON_FAITH] Faith generation in cities founded on Hills. Units receive +4 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength on Hills.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_MENELIK_NAME]Council of Ministers

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_ETHIOPIAN_OROMO_CAVALRY_DESCRIPTION]Ethiopian unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. Has additional sight and receives no [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty from moving in Hills.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_ETHIOPIAN_OROMO_CAVALRY_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION]Ethiopian unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. Stronger and greater sight than the Courser that it replaces. Receives no [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty from moving in Hills.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_UNIT_ETHIOPIAN_OROMO_CAVALRY_NAME]Oromo Cavalry
